mission: Accroître le développement du capital humain des groupes sous-représentés grâce à un programme de mentorat dirigé par la communauté
vision: Fournir une plate-forme pour l'inclusion radicale des groupes sous-représentés afin de favoriser la démocratisation de l'enseignement supérieur.

Integrity.Title: Integrity
Integrity.Value: Nous cherchons à vivre selon les normes les plus élevées d'honnêteté personnelle et de comportement ; nous ne compromettons jamais notre réputation et agissons toujours dans le meilleur intérêt du développement.

Compassion.Title: Compassion
Compassion.Value: Nous cherchons à vivre selon les normes les plus élevées d'honnêteté personnelle et de comportement ; nous ne compromettons jamais notre réputation et agissons toujours dans le meilleur intérêt du développement.

Altruism.Title: Altruisme
Altruism.Value: Nous sommes attachés à un développement qui répond aux besoins du présent sans compromettre la capacité des générations futures à répondre aux leurs.

Respect.Title: Respect
Respect.Value: Nous sommes attachés à un développement qui répond aux besoins du présent sans compromettre la capacité des générations futures à répondre aux leurs.

Empower.Title: Habiliter
Empower.Value: Nous sommes attachés à un développement qui répond aux besoins du présent sans compromettre la capacité des générations futures à répondre aux leurs.

Sustainability.Title: Durabilité
Sustainability.Value: Nous sommes attachés à un développement qui répond aux besoins du présent sans compromettre la capacité des générations futures à répondre aux leurs.

MentorRecruitment.Title: Recruitment of Mentors
MentorRecruitment.Value: An application window is opened to recruit volunteer mentors between August 22nd and September 30, 2022.

MenteeRecruitment.Title: Recruitment of Mentees
MenteeRecruitment.Value: Concurrent application shall be open to mentees between September 8th and 7th October 2022.

Pairing.Title: Pairing of Mentors and Mentees
Pairing.Value: Pair of mentors and mentees shall be completed in October 2022.

Mentoring.Title: Mentoring
Mentoring.Value: Mentorship shall be completed between 1st November 2022 to March 30, 2023.

Feedback.Title: Feedback
Feedback.Value: Feedback from both mentors and mentees shall be collected in April 2023 to help improve the programme.

Closing.Title: Closing Ceremony
Closing.Value: A virtual closing ceremony will be held in early May 2023 where mentors and mentees can give account of their experience in the program.

ApplicationNotification: La fenêtre de candidature GAIN se situe entre le 8 septembre et le 7 octobre 2022.

Underrepresented.Title: Underrepresented Minorities
Underrepresented.Value: Applicants from the global South and underrepresented minorities in the Global North.

FirstGeneration.Title: First Generation
FirstGeneration.Value: A candidate whose parent(s)/legal guardian(s) have not completed a bachelor’s degree.

GenderedMinorities.Title: Gendered Minorities
GenderedMinorities.Value: Women, non-binary applicants, and trans applicants of any gender orientation.

LowIncome.Title: Low-Income
LowIncome.Value: Candidates  from households with net income below the United Nations and World Bank’s poverty measures.

DisabledPersons.Title: Persons with disabilities
DisabledPersons.Value: Candidate who have a physical or mental impairment that substantially limits one or more major life activities, a person who has a history or record of such an impairment, or a person who is perceived by others as having such an impairment.

LGBTQ.Title: LGBTQ+
LGBTQ.Value: Lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, intersex, or asexual applicants as described by the Human Rights Campaign.

MentorContent: Mentors support and assist mentees through guidance and feedback on their application portfolio: CV, Statement of Purpose, selecting graduate schools, and the professors aligned to their career interests. The mentoring will be done virtually on an agreed schedule between the mentor and the mentee at regular intervals. This is a volunteering program, so graduate students from any university across the world can participate in helping other young people. Graduate students have gained years of experience searching for scholarship opportunities, and thus, are equipped with the tools and skillsets to improve mentees' applications to graduate programmes.
ReachOut: reach out if you have questions about the application process, eligibility, timeline, etc.
GetInvolved: reach out if you would like to get involved in GAIN.
Partnership: reach out if you want to donate and/or partner with us.
